intro: Hessea zeyheri, commonly known as the Zeyher's hessea, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, cylindrical stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces vibrant yellow flowers during the winter months, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Hessea zeyheri is well adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick stems to survive drought conditions. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an important species in its native habitat.
